publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2524# Elaine Smith: International Women’s Day, 8 March 2005—That the Parliament notes the significance of 8 March 2005 as International Women’s Day; endorses the role which this day plays in recognising, promoting and celebrating women’s issues world-wide; congratulates the many groups and organisations who strive to create a fairer society for women here in Scotland; recognises, in particular, the work of the Equal Opportunities Commission and its highly-successful Pregnant and Productive campaign which aims to highlight the problems that pregnant woman encounter in the workplace and ensure that pregnant women and their employers are fully aware of their rights and responsibilities under existing sexual discrimination laws; notes that an estimated 30,000 working women leave their jobs each year because of pregnancy discrimination; considers that the Scottish Parliament and the Scottish Executive can play a key role in improving the situation in Scotland, and believes that continual support should be given to the development of programmes that educate women and employers on maternity-related issues, including their legal rights.
